intro: Onobrychis bicolor, commonly known as the red and yellow burclover, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a legume, belonging to the family Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive bi-colored flowers that range from red to yellow. The plant typically grows in dry, sunny environments and has small, trifoliate leaves. Its seed pods are hairy and contain several small, rounded seeds. Onobrychis bicolor is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to fix nitrogen in the soil.
